name: Prelude
description: You must learn how to survive in the Over World. You can't harvest everything you must have to proper tools. You will need a farm, and learn how to cook.     Progression is made by completing quests leading down.

quests.name: Collect Gravel
quests.description: Wood will splinter, and Stone is heavy. Flint is a superior material to make tools from. You can find Flint in gravel. Or you can craft three gavel into two flint.

quests.name: Flint Pickaxe
quests.description: A Flint Pickaxe has the same harvest as Stone. You will need it to harvest Tin and Copper. Flint lasts much longer then Stone or Wood, but less then any metal.

quests.name: Copper Ore
quests.description: Copper can be used to craft tools that will last much longer then Flint tools. Copper Ore is found around height 48, ±16 meters, in long narrow veins, centered around a Mother lode of ore.

quests.name: Tin Ore
quests.description: Tin is most used as a component of machines. Tin can be found around height 60, ±12 meters, in long narrow veins, centered around a Mother lode of ore.

quests.name: Furnace to cook and smelt
quests.description: Collect plenty of stones to craft 4 compressed cobblestone. Then craft a Furnace.

quests.name: Time to use that Education
quests.description: You need to find Tin and Copper to make bronze tools..

tasks.longDescription: To make bronze you will need to first craft an Engineer's Hammer.
To make dusts, place an Ore Block with your Engineer's Hammer in the crafting grid.
Bronze dust is made from 3 copper dust and 1 tin dust.

quests.name: Build a Coal Coak Oven
quests.description: A Coke oven is used to make Coal Coke, and Creosote Oil. Coal Coke will burn for twice as long as Coal. Creosote Oil is used to treat wood. To Build the Coke Oven, place 27 of the Coke Bricks in a 3x3x3 cube then right-click one of the sides' center block with an Engineer's Hammer. Refer to the Engineer's Manual for more information.

quests.name: Stone Hammer
quests.description: Hammers will mine in a 3 by 3 area. Makes them very useful to make mineshafts.

quests.name: Composting your Future
quests.description: Compost is great stuff, you can use it like bonemeal. Although it is 30% less efficient then Bone meal.

tasks.longDescription: Place extra seeds and saplings in the Compost Bin. Slowly these will turn into compost.It takes 8 items to make 1 compost.
Starting out your best use of compost is to make garden soil. Tilled Garden Soil does not require water, for crops to grow. However there are some crops there just will not grow in garden soil.

quests.name: I hope you like Stew
quests.description: To make a meal you are going to have to cook those raw crops. Once you have crafted a Clay Pan, place it on top of a furnace, or open flame. You may need to hold shift to place it on top of a Furnace.

tasks.longDescription: To craft a Clay Pan you need 5 Hardened Clay, and 5 bricks. You can make Hardened Clay by smelting it in a Furnace.
Craft a medium clay flower pot. Use 5 Hardened Clay in a U formation.
Craft a Clay Pan. In the crafting table place a medium clay flower pot in the middle slot. Then place Bricks, to it's sides and make a row of bricks below.

quests.name: Seeds of your growth
quests.description: Clearly you need seeds to make a farm.

tasks.longDescription: Away from water sources, Use a Flint Hoe on grass. This may uncover seeds.

quests.name: Growing Crops
quests.description: Crops grow faster if you water them.

tasks.longDescription: You will need to fill the Watering Can with water by right click it on water.

quests.name: Engineering your Future
quests.description: An Engineer's Hammer is used to crush ores into dust. It is also used to complete some multiblock structures. Perhaps you should consult the manual.

quests.name: Aluminum Ore
quests.description: Aluminum is another metal used mostly in building machines. The stone furnace does a poor job of smelting Aluminum. Other means of extracting this ore will yield more ingots. You will find Aluminum Ore around height 94, ±34 meters. Medium mother lodes with 2-4 horizontal veins.

quests.name: Mind your table manners
quests.description: A cultured person like yourself uses Chopsticks.

quests.name: Less is Grater then More
quests.description: A food grater is used to Mince ingredients to prepare then to be cooked.

quests.name: Tanning Rack
quests.description: A Tanning Rack is a simple machine. Place rawhide on each side and wait. There is no way of speeding up this process. However with some ingenuity you could automate the process of placing rawhide, and removing leather.

quests.name: Drying Rack
quests.description: The Drying Rack uses the climate to change items, either Drying them or allowing Fermentation. Drying Mode is active when it's in brightness of 10 or more. Fermentation mode is active in brightness of 9 or less. The the humidity of the biome will effect how fast the Drying Rack works. Drying Mode, works faster in low humidity, while Fermentation works faster in high humidity.

quests.name: Rawhide
quests.description: Animals will drop their Rawhide, you will have to treat it to make leather.

quests.name: Basic Back Pack
quests.description: A backpack to hold all your stuff.

quests.name: Linen String
quests.description: Often you can use Linen String as an replacement for Spider String.

quests.name: Backpack Upgrades
quests.description: Your backpack can be upgraded with more functionality.To apply a backpack upgrade place the upgrade with the backpack in a crafting grid.

tasks.longDescription: Hold shift to learn more about these backpack upgrades.

quests.name: Leather Tunic
quests.description: Armor is the key to survival. You will need better armor, but this will do.

quests.name: Saddled with work
quests.description: Who wants to walk everywhere you should saddle one of these horses and explore afar.

quests.name: Copper Shears
quests.description: With shears you can collect grass, leaves and wool.

quests.name: Wish for a Horse of your own
quests.description: Can't find any horses? There is this cantrip that will create a horse.

quests.name: Engineer's Manual
quests.description: The Engineer's Manual is a book added by Immersive Engineering. It is an in-game guide to the mod and it's mechanics.

quests.name: Locker Mk I
quests.description: It's like a chest that forms a locker when two are stacked vertically. This will only happen if both are made from the same materials.

quests.name: Improved Chest Mk I
quests.description: These chests will only form a double chest when both are made from the same materials. They can also be Upgraded.

quests.name: A Chest for your stuff
quests.description: Wood chests are but the first means of storing your stuff.

quests.name: Shelves
quests.description: The shelf can hold up to 4 different stacks of items and can be used without a GUI. Right-clicking the Shelf with any Block or Item will put it on the shelf. Right clicking an item or block that is on the Shelf will cause that item or block to pop off.

quests.name: Storage Drawers
quests.description: Put your most frequently used items within convenient reach. Right-Click: Insert full stack in hand into drawer. Double-Right-Click: Insert all compatible stacks in inventory into drawer. Left-Click: Remove a single item from the drawer. Shift+Left-Click: Remove a full stack from the drawer. Shift+Right-Click with empty hand: Open a UI to see exact item counts and manage applied upgrades.

quests.name: Work Table
quests.description: An Upgrade to your basic crafting table which remembers the last nine used recipes. Left click one of the recipes shown in the right-hand side to automatically fill in the crafting grid. Right-click to lock a memorized recipe and prevent a newer recipe from bumping it off. Resources need to go into the internal inventory.

quests.name: Engineer's ToolBox
quests.description: The Engineer's ToolBox is used to store tools and other items.Right-clicking it will open it. Each slot can only store a specific type of item/block; "Food" can store edibles, "Tools" can store tools, "Wiring" can store Immersive Engineering coils and similar items, and "Anything" can store, as it sounds, any block or item.

quests.name: Place to keep your Armor
quests.description: This armor stand store your armor, just right click to swap a piece. If it powered redstone is placed under it, it will swap all of your armor when you right click.

quests.name: Size Upgrade Mk II
quests.description: Improved Chests and Lockers can be upgraded in place. Craft an size upgrade and right click using the upgrade on the Improved Chest or Locker.

quests.name: Wooden Storage Crate
quests.description: The Wooden Storage Crate is like a chest but when broken, all of the items are kept. Right-clicking it allows access to it's contents.

quests.name: Wooden Barrel
quests.description: The Wooden Barrel will stores liquids, and keep it's contents when broken. Right-clicking it with a Bucket, or bottle will transfer the liquid from the Bucket to the Wooden Barrel. However, not all liquids can be stored in a Wooden Barrel; "hot" liquids (such as Lava) and "gases" (such as Steam) are not allowed in it.

quests.name: Wooden Post
quests.description: The Wooden Post is a block for placing lights, wires and Transformer on in an aestheticly pleasing way. It is four blocks tall. The wooden part of it is climbable, similar to a Ladder. Hitting a side of the top block with an Engineer's Hammer will spring an "arm" from it. The arm will automatically flip if a block is placed under it.

quests.name: Creosote Oil Challenge
quests.description: When you cook Coal or Logs in your Coke Oven, Creosote Oil is created as a by product. You can use Creosote Oil to treat wood in several ways.

tasks.longDescription: To obtain a bottle of Creosote Oil, Place empty glass bottles in the blue slot of the Coke Oven. In Immersive Engineering Machines blue is input, and red is output.
You can craft a bottle of Creosote Oil with wood slabs to make wooden Ties, which are used with iron rails to make track.
A bottle of Creosote Oil and a wood log, makes a Creosote Wood Block that can be crafting into stairs and slabs.
Lastly surrounding a bottle of Creosote Oil with wood planks makes Treated Wood Planks. These can be crafting into many things.

quests.name: Chalcedony
quests.description: An odd jewel chalcedony can be made by cooking flint blocks. Specialized tools can be made from chalcedony.

quests.name: Chalcedony Tools
quests.description: Tools can be made of Chalcedony are superior to Flint. However Copper tools more then double the durability. Althought Chalcedony is sharper then Copper.

tasks.longDescription: Pruning shears are a tool to assist in the harvest of the crop. It will harvest some crops in a 3x3 area.

quests.name: Bowl Rack
quests.description: A bowl rack is a great place to keep your bowls after you have used them.

quests.name: Simple Stew
quests.description: A rather bland and Light Meal. However it will substain you. Before you start, make sure your Clay Pan is on top of a heat source. For example a Furnace.

tasks.longDescription: To make Minced Carrots and Potatos, place the grater in the crafting table with two Carrots and two Potatos.

Use the Minced Vegetable on Clay Pan. Once you have done so, you will beable to see the stew inside the pan. Next to serve the stew, take an empty bowl, and use that on the Clay Pan. Each time you do so, the liquid level will go down.

quests.name: Meatly Stew
quests.description: Do you miss hearty and flavorful food? This stew is just what you need.

tasks.longDescription: Use a grater in the crafting table with any raw Meat, two Carrots, two Potatos, and either a Garlic or Onion.
Just like the Simple Stew, use the Minced Ingredients for Meaty Stew on a Clay Pan, to cook the Meaty Stew. Use Bowls to serve yourself.

quests.name: New Ladders
quests.description: Ever wish you could place ladders to go up or down? Well now you can! After you have placed one sturdy ladder left click it with a sturdy ladder in hand, will place it on top of the stack of ladders. The rope ladder works the same way but only placing ladders down.

quests.name: Chutes not Ladders
quests.description: Chutes are like simple hoppers. They just place what's inside them into an inventory below them.

quests.name: A Bed don't look under it
quests.description: Odd how sleeping keeps monsters from appearing.

quests.name: Tin Plates
quests.description: Tin Plates are made by placing the Engineer's Hammer and a Tin Ingot in the crafting table. You will find that Plates are often used to craft machines. There must be a way of automating the creation of plates.

quests.name: Copper Plates
quests.description: Copper Plates are made by placing the Engineer's Hammer and a Copper Ingot in the crafting table. You will find that Plates are often used to craft machines. There must be a way of automating the creation of plates.

quests.name: Gather Clay
quests.description: You will need to find clay. It's used to build many useful machines. For example Clay Pans make the next tier of food. Coke Brick's can be used to make an Coke Oven that will cook, Logs into charcoal and Coal into Coal Coke.

quests.name: Wooden Bucket
quests.description: Can Pickup Water and Milk.

quests.name: Smelted Bronze
quests.description: To make Bronze ingots, place the Bronze Dust in a Furnace.

quests.name: Flint Axe
quests.description: You are going to need a lot of wood. Craft a flint Axe to chop down trees.

tasks.longDescription: Hand in these magic components, to receive an Enchanted Axe

quests.name: Flint Shovel
quests.description: You have a farm to build. That's going to require some digging. Craft a Flint Shovel.

quests.name: For the Barbecue
quests.description: You have slaughtered a pig in one blow. Time for a feast!

quests.name: Boxs of stuff
quests.description: A good way of storing logs, is to make them into boxs.

tasks.longDescription: You can smelt those boxes into charcoal. Three planks will smelt three items.

quests.name: Compost Challenge
quests.description: Challenges are not part of the progression. However they do offer great rewards.

quests.name: Leather Challenge
quests.description: Challenges are not part of the progression. However they do offer great rewards.

quests.name: Copper Challenge
quests.description: Challenges are not part of the progression. However they do offer great rewards.

quests.name: Fertilizer
quests.description: Don't have the seeds to grow more a plant? You need fertilizer. When used on a plant more of them will sprout around the first one.          Does not work on AgriCraft crops or Magical Plants.

tasks.longDescription: A task where the player has to craft specific items. You will first need to craft a plant powder. There are several kinds barries, ferns, leaves, and mushrooms. Collect 7 of the same type.
